page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: Our group, from Ladymead School, Taunton, surveyed four areas of Exmoor, a total of 48 square kilometres in an 'L' shape from West of Exford to Dunkery Beacon. We have therefore only written a few pages on this particular rectangle. This area is one of the West Country's foremost areas of natural beauty. It includes the high point of Dunkery Beacon, the beautiful views over land and sea at Webber's Post, and the deep wooded valleys of Horner Woods. On our visits, in Summer, the area was well frequented by holidaymakers but in Winter it is nearly deserted.
